place.name: ALLINGTON
place.gazetteerText: ALLINGTON, a parish in Amesbury district, Wilts; on an affluent of the river Avon, and on the Roman road from Old Sarum to Silchester, 2½ miles NE of Porton r. station, and 3¾ ESE of Amesbury. Post Town, Salisbury. Acres, 936. Real property, with Cholderton and Newton-Toney, £4,537. Pop., 93. Houses, 20. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Salisbury. Value, £270. Patron, the Earl of Craven. The church is very good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

place.name: ALLINGTON
place.gazetteerText: ALLINGTON, a tything in Allcannings parish, Wilts; near the Kennet and Avon canal, 4 miles ENE of Devizes. Real property, £1,438. Pop., 159. Houses, 34. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
